channel.title: Opinion Thread: The Fool (ToL)
channel.description:
I've heard many things about the Fool, but I told myself I wouldn't influence the thread so yeah.
What is your Opinion on the Fool in Throne of Lies? Why is it that way?
Please don't go off on tangents that have nothing to do with the thread.
Please spread this thread around like butter on bread (or toast) so we can get a wide variety of opinions on this topic.

item.title: Opinion Thread: The Fool (ToL)
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
The fool fails at making people not lynch the scummiest player (which is how the game should generally be played, because it re-enforces good play) because the defense of “they could be fool” is an easy but heavy defense to make.

The fool also enforces the scum to act like the fool as a gambit, which re-enforces bad play.

The fool also creates unnessecary WIFOM of whether they are scum, fool, or town. This is unnessecary because you shouldn’t be punished for lynching players that hinder your goal of winning. (Side note: I do condone the killing players of your team who in the endgame will lose the game for you)
